Hi, I´m looking for some help to run the cli on osx. Regarding the documentation it should be in
```cd /opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric build/bin/peer```

but it´s not there :disappointed:
<@U3TK1BQUA|harini> has joined the channel
have you built it?
make peer
<@U3SUPJ708|warb> has joined the channel

<@U3S1PENVA> No, but when i try to run ```make peer``` I get following error message
```Step 2 : ADD gopath.tar.bz2 $GOPATH/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric
Error processing tar file(bzip2 data invalid: bad magic value in continuation file): 
make: *** [build/image/src/.dummy] Error 1
````
```brew install gnu-tar —with-default-names```doesn´t help :disappointed:
its likely that it's not yet in your path
as that definitely does work
what's the output of `tar --version`
bsdtar 2.8.3 - libarchive 2.8.3
which is the stock OSX one
10.12.2 (the latest version)
you may simply need to open a new terminal window

or make sure the `/usr/local/bin` is in your PATH ahead of `/usr/bin`

or in the same terminal window:

```
export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
which tar
tar --version
```
change the order helps to solve the problem :wink: Thanks <@U0PB67X4K>
np

same issue
on macOS
do you have rocksdb installed?
also, I think you use macOS, so there chaincode containers cannot really communicate with peer process
so I had to go back to using vagrant
ok, but just to make sure: If i run `peer chaincode  deploy ......` (after register the chaincode) does peer creates a docker container to run the chaincode?
<@U3TNHH1NW|dknochen> has joined the channel
yes it does. However, docker container crashes with a message that it could not talk to the peer process
so this happens because of this: <https://github.com/docker/compose/issues/3800>

attachments.title: "network_mode: host" does not use the network of host machine · Issue #3800 · docker/compose · GitHub
attachments.text: Hi, actually I want to deploy all my applications in one machine and I use "network_mode: host" for sharing the same network of host machine inside docker container. But I find that I can't access ...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: "network_mode: host" does not use the network of host machine · Issue #3800 · docker/compose

text: ok. it helps :slightly_smiling_face: And do you know why it´s not possible to stop this process after deployment? , eg CORE_CHAINCODE_ID_NAME=ccID CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=0.0.0.0:7051 ./mychaincode.
not sure I understood correclty, but in dev mode all chaincode invoke/queries are handled by this process
so if you stop it, you can’t invoke it anymore

I trying to understand the different between register and deploy and all the running processes. If chaincode deploy -n ccID -c… is creating the docker container with the chaincode, why do i need the running register process?
you need to run a process only in dev mode
at least for v1, I did not work much with v0.6

ok … and one more question :slightly_smiling_face: Is it possible to deploy more then one chaincode in one ledger? If yes, does the ledger starts one docker for all chaincodes or for each one docker container?

<@U2ZPJHMNY> 1. Yes, 2. (for v0.6 anyway) one docker container per chaincode for each of the validating peers (not sure though how that will work in v1 in terms of which type of peer will need to run all the chaincodes, or if a certain chaincode can be run on a subset of peers, etc.)

does fabric-baseimage still have a ‘latest’ tag?

<@U3UHTDA2J|simo> has joined the channel

emdall:bales jtray$ docker pull hyperledger/fabric-baseimage:latest
Pulling repository <http://docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage|docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
Tag latest not found in repository <http://docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage|docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
<@U3P7ELDTN> <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage/tags/>
you probably want the one tagged x86_64-0.2.2

<@U0KM61BCP> vp0_1         | 16:27:23.446 [dockercontroller] deployImage -> ERRO 01d Error building images: Tag latest not found in repository <http://docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage|docker.io/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage>
the baseimages are architecture specific
this is the peer loading baseimage
this is a bug then... supposed to have an explicit tag
as part of chaincode deployment
workaround would be to docker pull hyperledger/fabric-baseimage:x86_64-0.2.2
and then tag it latest
this is v0.6?
yes, 0.6.x
yeah, cuz I am pretty sure we have a different image now (hyperledger/fabric-cc)
I’ll try that, thanks
<@U0KM61BCP> it worked! do you think the same bug could be affecting bluemix deployments?
<@U3P7ELDTN> I don't believe so
<@U0KM61BCP> thanks for the tag-as-latest solution, worked!
